intro: Moussonia jaliscana, commonly known as the Jalisco moussonia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
